channel.title: Research on Hector Rufrancos
channel.description: Recent content in Research on Hector Rufrancos

item.title: Household structure, labour participation and economic inequality in Britain, 1937-61
item.description: This paper investigates household income/expenditure inequality using survey data for the United Kingdom from 1937 to 1961. Published in EHR, 2023.

item.title: The unequal effect of pollution exposure on labour supply across gender
item.description: This paper studies the effects of air pollution on labour supply by gender in Mexico City. We differentiate between the health, income and policy effect.

item.title: Does the depth of informality influence welfare in urban Sub-Saharan Africa?
item.description: This paper studies the relationship between household welfare and informality. Assuming income pooling, we propose new measures of household informality. Published in OEP, 2022.

item.title: Escaping from hunger before WW1: the nutritional transition and living standards in Western Europe and USA in the late nineteenth century
item.description: This paper examines cross country nutritional differences before WWI using the USCL survey. Published in Cliometrica, 2023.

item.title: The impact of University reopenings on COVID-19 cases in Scotland
item.description: This paper estimates the impact of University reopenings in Scotland in Autumn 2020 on COVID-19 cases in Scottish neighbourhoods. This was vetted onto Covid Economics, 2021.

item.title: How hungry were the poor in late 1930s Britain?
item.description: This paper re-examines energy and nutrition available to British working-class households in the late 1930s using individual household expenditure and consumption data.. Published in EHR, 2021.

item.title: Are There Gains to Joining a Union? Evidence from Mexico
item.description: This paper shows the impact on wages and non wage benefits of joining and leaving a union in Mexico. Published in BJIR, 2019.

item.title: Institutions in the Fast Lane? Strike Petitions and the Electoral Cycle in Mexico
item.description: This paper studies the role of unions during local election campaigns in Mexico.

item.title: The Poor and the Poorest, fifty years on: Evidence from British Household Expenditure Surveys of the 1950s and 1960s
item.description: This paper revisits Abel-Smith and Townsend's landmark study of poverty in early post World War 2 Britain using the modern methods. Published in JRSSA , 2017.

item.title: Income Inequality and Crime: A Review and Explanation of the Time–series Evidence
item.description: This review analyses the time–series evidence of the effects of changing income inequality on crime for a number of countries and types of crime. Published in Social Criminol, 2013.

item.title: Resting Papers
item.description: This archive gives some idea of my resting papers, perhaps one day they will see the light of day...
